thread.title: The high-flying Ben Carson campaign
thread.title_full: The high-flying Ben Carson campaign - POLITICO

author: Glenn Thrush
title: The high-flying Ben Carson campaign
text:
Ben Carson's campaign has a big appetite for the good life. There was the $1,015 meal at Johnny's Half Shell, a swanky Washington, D.C. seafood restaurant. The $533 stay at Hotel Monaco, one of the nicest hotels in Baltimore. And a $1400 steak dinner at Sparks Steakhouse in New York City.
The campaign spent $2,089 at New York's iconic Waldorf Hotel and frequented Westins over Best Westerns.
The luxury spending is notable because while Carson raised $20 million in the third quarter he also burned through $14 million of it.
Carson, sitting near the top of the GOP field in the polls, has $11 million in cash on hand. His quarterly haul has eclipsed all other Republican contenders.
